Silicon Valley Hiking and Networking Meetup

A fun group of people who meet every Tuesday morning at 6:30 am at Rancho San Antonio in Cupertino (off Hwy 280 & 85) for an early morning networking hike. It's a terrific way to keep fit and meet interesting people at the same time. This is a particularly good group for people who may be in career transition mode, because of the group's philosophy of mutual support, the power of networking and a group hike! Come have fun each and every week hanging out with the best local business owners. See how friendly competition of giving and getting the most business leads grows our businesses and solidifies friendships. 

Each and every week one of our members gets to be the center of attention where they educate our members and guests on what they do so we can refer more business to them or learn how to incorporate their business strategies into our own.


Even though we have lots of fun we do follow a structured format so that we get out on time and many members say that this day becomes one of their most productive days.

results.description:
You’re invited to attend this MeetUp for FREE. All you need to do is RSVP ahead of time.

Join us for the most PROACTIVE  business networking meeting you’ll ever attend.

The goal of the meeting is to get you connected to new people and start building trust quickly.

We’ve taken out all the fluff of networking; pitching, recruiting, speeches, presentations and made it all about you getting connected.

The way business networking was intended.

We make it fun, simple, yet effective!

★★★How this MeetUp Works ★★★

ATTENTION: Faz does offer coffee and breakfast, if you do attend this Meetup support Faz buy at least purchasing some coffee :)

0. RSVP to this meeting prior to arriving at the meeting then leave a comment to say hi.

1. When you arrive check-in with the meeting host.

2. The first portion of the meeting is OPEN networking, feel free to mingle before we get started.

3. We will take 30 seconds to introduce ourselves. (Your name, professional and who is a power partner)

4. Finally, we will break off into one-to-one meetings so you can reconnect or start a new relationship.

Why break off into a one-to-one meeting? We've found the fastest way to build a relationship is one on one. You simply get to know, like and trust each other much faster.

It's that simple!

Look forward to meeting you soon.

Thanks, Justin

PS. We love referrals so; please invite those you know, like, and trust.

★★★ Business Networking Tips ★★★

1. Arrive 15 minutes early.

2. Dress to impress always.

3. Consistent attend the meeting each week.

4. Don’t pitch or recruit, no one came to buy stuff or join anything. Focus on building relationships.

★★★ Frequently Asked Questions ★★★

How much does it cost? Your first visit is always free. 

Is this meeting 1 per profession? Nope, it's open to any and all. The way we've set up the meeting it's totally ok to have more than one profession at the meeting. 

How many attend the meetings? If you RSVP that would be one more. Ok, it's not the size of the meeting it's the quality. Just RSVP and come on down, we will make it fun.

Successful Thinkers Network is a group of like minded and committed individuals who believe people will buy or use product / service from people they like, know, and trust.  Building relationship is key to the membership in helping others move forward.  Members share ideas and information to benefit the community and their business.

The Successful Thinkers Network's mission is to help develop relationships that will enable members to find solutions to business challenges.   Attend our meetings to learn more about how our concept works for you.

Topic: Chose Your Destiny

Speaker: Avi Gingold

Avi Gingold has spent over 20 years working with High-Tech Startups in various executive positions in International Sales, Business Development and Marketing. When the dot com crashed he became an entrepreneur and for the last 9 years he has been consulting and working with small businesses to help protect them and grow their business. Avi is an Identity Theft Protection Specialist representing two major companies, Kroll Advisory Solutions and Legal Shield.

In his presentation, Avi will be educating you on the function of the brain and the role it plays in the development of your future as well as help you set goals for the new year.

results.description:
NOTE: THIS MEETUP IS IN PALO ALTO at 6:15pm PDT


Let's kick off the new year with a PostgreSQL meetup! 

Schedule:

6:15pm – 7:00pm: Food and networking

7:00pm – 7:45pm: Kafka for DBAs by Gwen Shapira

As DBAs and data architects, there are some things we care a lot about. For example, providing consistent performance on our OLTP databases, and making sure the ETL processes will land data correctly and on-time in the data warehouse.Business analysts care a lot about other things - for example getting the newest data to their dashboards and being able to run crazy queries really fast without anyone killing the queries for silly reasons like "performance". They also want to be able to get all the data they need without having to integrate with gazillion data stores.Apache Kafka, a distributed queue developed at LinkedIn to solve the problem of integrating databases at large scale, offers a surprising solution to all these problems. Which probably explains why it gains popularity so fast.In this session, we will explain what is Apache Kafka and why it rapidly becomes the secret weapon in the fight to keep databases sane.


About Gwen Shapira

Gwen is a system architect at Confluent helping customers achieve success with their Apache Kafka implementation. She has 15 years of experience working with code and customers to build scalable data architectures, integrating relational and big data technologies. She currently specializes in building real-time reliable data processing pipelines using Apache Kafka. Gwen is an Oracle Ace Director, an author of "Hadoop Application Architectures", and a frequent presenter at industry conferences. Gwen is also a committer on the Apache Kafka and Apache Sqoop projects. When Gwen isn't coding or building data pipelines, you can find her pedaling on her bike exploring the roads and trails of California, and beyond. 


7:45pm – 8:30pm: PostgreSQL and Linux Containers by Jignesh Shah

In this session we will look into rise of Linux Containers in DevOps and a quick dive into the docker implementation including how to use volumes in docker containers. We will also talk about common pitfalls of using PostgreSQL in docker containers and how to avoid them.


About Jignesh Shah

Jignesh works for AppOrbit. 


Can't join us in person? No need to RSVP--you can participate via LiveStream: https://livestream.com/pemo/postgresql


Want to give a talk?  Have a talk idea? Submit your idea here!
results.name: PA: South Bay PostgreSQL

results.description:
Connect with the Divine by singing HU.

HU is an ancient name for God. It is also a love Song to God. All that we can do with the word HU is sing it with reverence. It represents the love of God for Soul, and we are Soul. HU represents the enormous love that the Creator has for Its creation.

Hu can be sung by anyone, whether Christian, Muslim, or of any other religion. Hu will enhance it.

Benefits of Singing HU

Comfort, peace, calm

Inner light and Sound

Expanded Awareness

A release of fears

Answers to your questions

Spiritual protection

With eyes open or closed take a few breaths to relax. Then begin to sing HU, in a long drawn-out sound. Take another breath, and sing HU again. Continue for 20 minutes. SING HU WITH A FEELING OF LOVE, and it will gradually open your heart to God. Do this exercise every day, spend 20 minutes on it. this builds your spiritual stamina gently over time. Regular Daily practice is the key to success. Also when your day is hard, remember to Sing HU. It puts you back in line with the Holy Spirit. When you sing HU, you are saying to Divine Spirit, I've opened myself to you. Give me the understanding and wisdom to meet the waves of life, and problems, troubles, and whatever else. Give me the strength to meet Life.

From The Spiritual Experiences Guidebook, by Harold Klemp

results.description:
Come if you want to learn more about how to live a happier, more peaceful life.

Real (unconditional) Love is caring about the happiness of another person without wanting anything in return.  When we feel unconditionally loved and become more loving towards others, we lose the need to use our old coping behaviors.  We study, discuss and learn to practice the Real Love principles, which are described in Greg Baer’s series of Real Love books (see <a>http://www.RealLove.com).</a>;

We also practice telling the truth about ourselves in order for us to feel seen, accepted, and loved. Telling the truth about ourselves creates opportunities for other people to accept and love us as we really are - that's the definition of Real Love, or unconditional love.  No prior experience or level of participation is necessary.

This is a drop-in, no-charge, no-participation-required experience.  Just come and listen.

To help you better understand what we do here at the Tri-Valley Real Love Group, you can visit http://reallove.com/free-videoaudio/ and watch Greg's Top Ten videos or the Real Love Essentials Disc 1.

We meet every Wednesday, except for the 3rd week of the month, when we meet on Friday.

results.description:
January 5th, 2016 will be the launch event for our newly formed 101 photo club. Come join us for mingling followed by a talk by guest speaker Rick Whitacre, who specializes in astro-landscape photography. 

Schedule

Social: 7:00 PM - 7:30 PM

Speaker begins from 7:30PM - 9:30 PM

Admission

Admission is $25 at the door. Free for members.

Pre-register  [click here to register now] to receive a $5 discount on the admission fee. 

Please note that joining this Meetup group does not make you a member of the 101 Photo Club.  Admission fee can be applied to the membership price if ticket holder joins within 1 months for a discount. See website for more information.

Launch Event

This event will be the first meeting of 101 photo club. We are thrilled to have generated so much interest in the professional and amateur photography community. Come join us for food and drinks, also be prepare to meet new friends and make new connections with experienced and fledgling photographers of the Bay Area. 

Speaker Topic: Astro-Landscape Photography (by Rick Whitacre)

Have you ever admired Star and Milky Way photography but always thought it could only be accomplished by advanced photographers that worked for National Geographic Magazine?  That might have been true long ago, but with today's digital photography, a lot of the guesswork and mystery has been removed to enable most anyone with a modern DSLR to capture some amazing images, especially with sensors that are getting better every year.  Astro-landscape photography is the combination of traditional landscapes with celestial objects, such as stars, meteors, auroras, planets, and the moon.  Featured photographer, Rick Whitacre, will be giving a talk on astro-landscape photography to introduce you to this exciting art form.  

Rick will cover:

• Star Trail Images

• Milky Way Images

• Capturing Auroras

• Capturing Meteors

• Eclipse photography and time-lapse

• Equipment options and choices

• Tools, apps, programs, and safety

We hope you'll be inspired to create your own astro-landscape images!

Speaker Details

Rick Whitacre is a landscape photographer specializing in Astro-Landscape work such as Milky Way photography, Star Trails, Meteors, Auroras, and Light Painting. He loves getting out into the National and State Parks and finding the darkest skies possible. He has found that night photography and astro-landscape photography have allowed me to create new and different images. During His talk, He will try to take you on a journey of the night sky and introduce you to astro-landscape photography. You can find more information about Rick at this link.

'As soon as you honor the present moment, all unhappiness and struggle dissolve, and life begins to flow with joy and ease. When you act out present moment awareness, whatever you do becomes imbued with a sense of quality, care and love.' Eckhart Tolle

Lets get together, practice breathing techniques and a guided meditation to calm the mind.

results.description:
Let's kick off the new year with a new PostgreSQL Meetup.

Speakers:

"Kafka for DBAs" - Gwen Shapira
"PostgreSQL and Linux Containers" - Jignesh Shah


This Meetup is sponsored and hosted by Pivotal. Live streaming is available, details can be found here: http://www.meetup.com/Pivotal-Open-Source-Hub/events/227506336/

Kafka for DBAs:

As DBAs and data architects, there are some things we care a lot about. For example, providing consistent performance on our OLTP databases, and making sure the ETL processes will land data correctly and on-time in the data warehouse.Business analysts care a lot about other things - for example getting the newest data to their dashboards and being able to run crazy queries really fast without anyone killing the queries for silly reasons like "performance". They also want to be able to get all the data they need without having to integrate with gazillion data stores.Apache Kafka, a distributed queue developed at LinkedIn to solve the problem of integrating databases at large scale, offers a surprising solution to all these problems. Which probably explains why it gains popularity so fast.In this session, we will explain what is Apache Kafka and why it rapidly becomes the secret weapon in the fight to keep databases sane.

PostgreSQL and Linux Containers:

In this session we will look into rise of Linux Containers in DevOps and a quick dive into the docker implementation including how to use volumes in docker containers. We will also talk about common pitfalls of using PostgreSQL in docker containers and how to avoid them.

About Gwen Shapira:

Gwen is a system architect at Confluent helping customers achieve success with their Apache Kafka implementation. She has 15 years of experience working with code and customers to build scalable data architectures, integrating relational and big data technologies. She currently specializes in building real-time reliable data processing pipelines using Apache Kafka. Gwen is an Oracle Ace Director, an author of "Hadoop Application Architectures", and a frequent presenter at industry conferences. Gwen is also a committer on the Apache Kafka and Apache Sqoop projects. When Gwen isn't coding or building data pipelines, you can find her pedaling on her bike exploring the roads and trails of California, and beyond.

About Jignesh Shah:

Jignesh works for AppOrbit.

• The winner of each group will move up and play the following week for free

• Get one free pass for the league play each month if you pay meetup dues. See more info at http://www.meetup.com/PongPlanet-Meetup-Group/messages/boards/thread/48590804

• No show may lose the qualification to play the following week or drop down to a lower group

• Table Tennis Shoes or Non-marking indoor sports shoes only

For more information please go to: www.pong-planet.com or email [masked]


ABOUT PongPlanet RR LEAGUES


The weekly Round Robin League is held every Tuesday and Sunday at PongPlanet Club. League director will have our leagues processed for USATT League Ratings. This league is for all-level players. League director will give you an estimate rating if you don't have one.


League Format

The league director starts off each league with a printout of potential league players, in the order of player rating. The format is to put the top five players in the first group, the next five are put in the second group, and so on down the list. If the number of players in the league is not divisible by five, then the number of players in some groups would be adjusted. 

Players play all other members in their group. The goal is to win the group, and to improve one’s league rating. Recommended format is best of 3 to 11 - depending on number of players and time available.


League Ratings

At the start of the league, players will start out with either USATT ratings or estimated ratings. League ratings will change in the same way that USATT ratings change, using the same rating chart. Ratings will be calculated online when results are input by the League Director. Unrated players will be given a rating of 800, if no better estimate is available. (These ratings may be adjusted later as more info is available.)

results.description:
How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other? It can feel unsafe, inappropriate, or unwelcome by those around you.


Instead, imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we've created!
It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or sports bar conversation.
You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.
What comes up might surprise you!


We play three communication games that will challenge you to consider questions like 'What are your relationships like?' 'What does Orgasm mean to you?' and 'What's one secret desire you have?'
Questions like these encourage vulnerability. And, what happens when you get vulnerable? It creates intimacy... which is what we're all searching for!
It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real.


At OneTaste Silicon Valley we teach Orgasmic Meditation (OM for short.) The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of OM, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!) - sort of like having the feeling of an incredible dessert without having consumed any of the calories.


You can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you. You don't have to do anything you don't want to, or answer any questions you don't want to answer.
It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

For questions feel free to contact David[masked] or Lisa at[masked]

Event goes from 8-9:30pm in Palo Alto.

Donation $15.00

We start on time so please arrive ten to fifteen minutes early.

Location will be sent to confirmed sign ups.
See you soon!

About Toastmasters International

Toastmasters International is a nonprofit educational organization that teaches public speaking and leadership skills through a worldwide network of clubs. 

Founded in October 1924, the organization currently has more than 280,000 members in 13,500-plus clubs in 116 countries.

Each week, Toastmasters helps more than a quarter million people of every ethnicity, education level and profession build their competence in communication so they can gain the confidence to lead others.

For information about local Toastmasters clubs, please visitwww.toastmasters.org. 
Follow @Toastmasters on Twitter.

We also offer child care and children's programs during Divorce and Relationship Recovery. Some of those programs require separate RSVPs and are not addressed by RSVPing on this page for dinner. More information and RSVP instructions.

Menu subject to change due to unforeseen circumstances.

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE EVENT DESCRIPTION.

There is a cover charge to attend this event.

A "YES" RSVP on our meetup site does not confirm your reservation.

Space is limited. Please only RSVP "Yes" if you will be attending.

Take advantage of early responder pricing!

Slots are limited. First come, first served!

Early Bird $7 plus Eventbrite fees

General Admission $12 plus Eventbrite fees

Late Bird $17 plus Eventbrite fees

In order to attend, you must register and pay here:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-foundations-of-business-with-paul-hoyt-session-1-leadership-tickets-19957818372

Or, pay $20 (cash) at the door.

Overview

Entrepreneurs are driven, brilliant, and excellent at many things – but it is the areas of inexperience that can cause them significant challenges and slow down their growth. Many businesses struggle because the entrepreneurs never receive the education and training in all of the areas of business, so they make expensive mistakes that cost them dearly.

The Foundations of Business seminar series is designed to provide the critical training that entrepreneurs need as they grow their business. This is going to be a series of seven workshops featuring the Seven Key Performance Areas of Business Success:

Jan 6 - Introduction and Leadership

Jan 13 - Marketing

Jan 20 - Product Development

Jan 27 - Operations

Feb 3 - Financial Management

Feb 10 - Sales

Feb 17 - Customer Service and Conclusion

Session 1: Introduction and Leadership

Leadership is the most important of all of the areas of business, and entrepreneurs need to be leader from the beginning. Understanding your role and responsibilities as the leader of your company is essential to success.

About the speaker:

Paul Hoyt, managing partner and best-selling author, has led hundreds of CEO’s, entrepreneurs, and executives from around the globe through their unique journeys of growth and discovery. His expertise, strong passion, and comfort “from the boardroom to the boiler room” allows him to propel professionals and organizations from a myriad of different industries and experience to reach the business and personal success they want.

His experience and extensive knowledge in the key performance areas of a business enables Paul to analyze and assess the strengths, opportunities and gaps of your foundations, and then develop the strategic and business plans, financial models, and growth strategies needed to improve profitability, productivity, and growth. His experience includes management responsibilities at Oracle, EDS, Litton Industries, and Qwest Cyber Solutions, and he’s helped clients and businesses of all sizes achieve tremendous success in funding and executing their growth and exit strategies, goals and objectives.

Paul is an authority at managing high risk, large-scale programs, and complex, cross-functional project teams, to achieve both incremental and revolutionary improvements across multiple and international locations. He has extensive experience in helping companies design, implement, and manage alliances and partnerships, and support channel sales and marketing organizations.

www.PaulHoyt.com
results.name: How to Start your Business. Session 1. Leadership

Start this new year with weekly exercise and come join the Loma Prieta Sierra Singles for a bit of mid-week conditioning exercise. This brisk walk will be starting at 6:15pm from the parking lot behind Hotel California at California and Ash in Palo Alto. This week we will walk to and through the streets of the Stanford Elite, and see who may still have holiday lights up before returning to the starting point.

This will be a medium-fast-paced walk of 5 miles along city streets and pathways. Portions of the walk, may not be well lit, so bring a flashlight or headlamp if you can.
Light-medium rain will not cancel, but route may be modified. Heavy rain will just give us an excuse to go for an early dinner. Option to join us for a bite to eat afterwards at one of the several nearby restaurants.

Leader: Denise Vann; [masked]; [masked]

Meeting location:

Parking Lot off Ash between California an! d Sherman in Palo Alto

Directions:

Google Ash & California, Palo Alto, CA.
From 280, take the Page Mill exit East. Turn Left on El Camino Real.
Turn right on California, go one block to Ash. Right on Ash.
Parking lot is in middle of block on your left. Look for us under a light post on the Ash side of the parking lot.

Nearby construction going on so please allow extra time to find parking.

To attend one of our events, there is NO ADMISSION FEE, unless specified.

This list is intended for Sierra Club Members and prospective members. People may attend our events on a limited basis before joining the club.
The events posted here are only some of the events we run each month. 
Find out about 30-40 events per month offered by Sierra Singles and, if you desire, join our club by going to http://lomaprieta.sierraclub.org/lpss/

State of California.

results.description:
WEDNESDAY, January 6, 6:30pm-11:00pm, IHOP Santa Clara, 4200 Great America Parkway, Santa Clara, CA 95054


First time there went well so heading back again.  Couple learnings from the prior go: 1) Our waiter will leave at 10, so pay up before then. 2) Please do not spread out across the entire room; we are not a large enough group to have it all to ourselves so they may seat other groups there.  

Games played last week (12/9): San-Ni-Ichi, Exploding Kittens, Sushi Go, 504, Power Grid, Hansa Teutonica, Valley of the Kings, Above and Below, Sentinels of the Multiverse, Welcome to the Dungeon, and probably more; I had to leave early.

============================

Greetings from SJBoardGamesClub, meeting since 2005.  Our claim to fame: Dinner! We enjoy a sit-down, waitstaff-served dinner along with our boardgaming.


Open gaming; meal purchase expected - IHOP didn't tell me anything about minimums, but please order something to make us good customers :)

------------------------------------

• About us: We play a mixture of board games and card games, from Euro-style strategy to American-syle thematic, and from light to heavy. We also enjoy the occasional party game or word game. 


• Newcomers, beginners, and families are welcome too, and we are always teaching games.

• We are a fun, friendly group with just one rule...buy food so we can keep coming here! 

• IHOP is putting us in their event room and marking off space for us, but we probably won't have it all to ourselves (it's a bigger room than Coco's and seats up to 100).  We should have enough room to spread out but we'll see how it goes.  If it doesn't work out, we'll try other locations.

• RSVPs are never required at, but always appreciated.


• This is a cross-post from http://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/SJBoardGamesClub/info so expect more people than you see RSVPing on this page.


• Feel free to cross-post this announcement wherever cross-posts are welcome.

We look forward to seeing you this Wednesday!

-Bart
results.name: Dinner and board games January 6 (and every Wednesday) IHOP Santa Clara

results.description:
Guidelines:

Writing can be posted on the Google Docs folder designated for the specific writing session.

GROUP RULES: 

1. Access to the GoogleDoc is given at or after your first Meetup that you attend in person. This allows the group to control access to the content. To take advantage of this rule, we recommend coming the the Writer's Discussion Group first and then attending your first Critique session.

2. Context/Purpose - If your writing sample is a continuation of previous writing, or it needs some sort of premise for critics to understand, please write a short summary at the top of your piece, so that people have a heads up. If you are looking for critique regarding a specific aspect alone, mention this here.

3. TRIGGER WARNINGS - If you write about certain topics: Graphic Violence, Rape/Non-Con, Incest, Child Abuse, Sexual Assault, etc. You MUST warn the group with a TRIGGER WARNING at the top of your piece. Our group is open to all writers and content, but we also give our writers the right to avoid reading topics that may cause PTSD flashbacks. You can warn for Sex if you want to, but it isn't held in the same category as the above topics
Failure to abide by this rule will result in a BAN

4. Supportive Critiquing and Discussion - Provide and respond to critiques in a tone that is supportive and communicates good faith. We encourage disagreements and clarifications that lead to friendly discussion and learning. But this is possible only in an environment where every individual feels welcome. Our group caters to people of diverse skill-levels, from beginners to experts. Hence, refrain from any form of intimidation, competitive bullying or personal insults. We follow a three-strike policy regarding this.

Limit writing samples to a max of:

2500 words if you post it on Google Docs prior.

250 words if you only bring a paper copy or upload at the meeting.

Upload & Comment Instructions :-

Once the folder is shared, go into "Year" and then "Month-Day" folder. For example, <Shared_Folder> / 2015 / Sep-1 / <Your_Document>

The format preferred is Google Word Document. There are two ways of doing this. 

- Create a New Untitled Document. Copy-Paste from your Local Document. Modify the Title

or

- Upload your Local Document, say Microsoft Word Doc. Then Open it, this will auto-create a new copy in Google Word Doc. Once the  Google Word Doc Copy is auto-created, then remove the Original Microsoft Word Doc.

To comment, Drag and Select the section of writing, right-click, and select "Comment" from the menu. A text-box will open up, fill in your comment there. Don't modify the original document. If you do so by mistake, comment so that the author is alerted.

Meeting

Meeting is Moderated by Sinead, unless she is out, then Abhirup is Moderator. 

1. If you are uploading at the meeting, be early. First half hour is any final reading and some socialization.

2. Then we begin critique. Critique takes place in order of appearance at the meeting. If you are late, you will be last. If you are early, you will be first. 

Also, feel free to just come and write, even if you don't have a piece to share!

Look forward to seeing you there!
results.name: Critique Session

~ FREE EVENT ~

Houston was just named the “#1 Fastest Growing City in America” by Forbes. Thanks in large part to the boom in horizontal drilling and fracking, which has helped the Houston metro area add a whopping 667,800 new jobs since 2005. The energy city is an economic powerhouse: its 4.5% year-over-year job growth rate is the nation’s fastest! 

This top-performing market is expected to remain on top in 2015. The most populous city in Texas had one of the best years in job creation with 104,700 for 2014, and is on pace to set an employment record this year adding jobs at twice the national rate! 

The energy industry and strong new construction sector is fueling the city’s economy and spurring expansion and jobs, thus continuing to drive market growth and supporting real estate activity. Combine that with an affordable housing market and you have incredible opportunity for real estate investors. 

Statistics we will discuss during this presentation:  
· 9.3% appreciation in 2014 
· Strong and steady rental market 
· #1 most populous city in Texas and 4th most populous city in the US 
· Only NYC is home to more Fortune 500 companies ahead of Houston 
· Low unemployment rate of 4.6% 
· Rated #1 in job growth by Forbes 
· Worldwide energy industry leader and continuing to expand 
· Home to Texas Medical Center, the world’s largest concentration of health care and research institutions 
· Booming medical tech sector 
· Port of Houston is huge in international import/export—ranked #1 in foreign tonnage in the US 

Join us as we hear from our Regional Rep about the amazing investment opportunities available in this top market that continues to exceed expectations with strong job growth and rising home appreciation. 

For more details, go to: https://www.marshallreddick.com/event/ed13d80e-6611-0ef6-4739-564cc5a07978

PLEASE NOTE: Our philosophy for real estate investing is strictly “Buy-and-Hold” and we do not condone or want any affiliation with those looking to make a quick buck in FLIPPING or WHOLESALING. Those short-term, fly-by-night strategies are full time jobs, not a means of investing hard-earned money for income and wealth building. Don’t quit your job. Build true wealth through the tax benefits, passive income, equity building, long-term appreciation and safe use of leverage that comes along with rental property ownership.  

Please be aware that NO SOLICITATION of any kind will be permitted at this or any of our events and you will be kindly asked to leave if you come with your own agenda and do not follow that rule. We spend lots of money, time and effort to deliver a very clear, successful and specific educational message of exactly what works in real estate and what doesn’t and have zero tolerance for “wheel-and-dealers.” We provide real estate investment opportunities that have been pre-screened by our expert real estate advisors and a reliable system of education, mentoring and investment opportunities backed by our 35+ years of being in business.

results.description:
Minigames and pickup games. Refuel with dinner and board games with us afterwards!

ALL ARE WELCOME! All athletic abilities, all levels of experience.

Skyfighters are also recruiting for the tournament team. Let us know if you're interested!

Bring cleats or other comfy running shoes, sunscreen, and water (there is a drinking fountain too).

Carpools available from Menlo Park, Palo Alto, Mountain View, Sunnyvale, and San Jose areas. Let us know in your RSVP by Thursday if you need a ride.

The Rules:

1. Be nice! 
We welcome all levels of players so understand some people are still learning! Ridicule and showboating are not our style!

2. Be communicative. 
Try to resolve any issues through friendly pointing out. E.g. : "Hey, you were hit." or "You can't tackle them; they don't have a ball"

3. Be open to feedback. 
Newbies: Know that your team, especially your beater or chaser partners, might shout instructions at you. Quidditch relies on communication. If you feel they are being rude or could communicate better, talk to them during water break and let them know for next time.

4. No conflicts on the pitch! 
If there is an issue you can't solve on the pitch in a friendly way, talk to one of our captains (Matthew, Dalia, or Janos) and they will take care of the issue. DO NOT get in a direct conflict with the person.

5. No recruiting for other teams! 
No recruiting for teams other than Skyfighters Quidditch Club. This is a Skyfighters-hosted event, meant for pickup games AND recruiting to Skyfighters. Of course, it goes both ways: we will not recruit players already on other teams who join us for pickup games. Let's keep this friendly!

So far our regulars already follow these rules because they are wonderfully nice people! They are laid out here so we're all on the same page! Let's play some quidditch!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for us next to the tennis courts and you'll see the blue and white hoops.
results.name: Quidditch Pickup Games - Wednesday at Rengstorff!

results.description:
It's a new year. Time for another meetup! Thanks to Jive Software for hosting us again.


6:30pm - Welcome! Food, drinks, social

7:00pm - Justin Karneges - What we can learn from XMPP

XMPP is the federated messaging protocol that couldn't quite take over the world. In this talk we'll go over what XMPP is, what it got right, what it got wrong, and how the lessons learned may impact future network systems.


Justin is Founder and CEO of Fanout. He contributed to XMPP in its early days.


7:30pm - Benjamin Goering - Interoperable JSON with W3C ActivityStreams and JSON-LD


Ben is Platform Product Manager at Livefyre.


8:00pm - Shout outs and lightning talks

Any members can make quick announcements about their companies/projects, or present lightning talks.

*lightning talks are 5-10 mins. You can use slides or not :) Please leave a comment below about your topic.

8:30pm - That's all folks. Thanks for joining us this month!
results.name: Messaging and standards

Join us for a special Satsung (spiritual community gathering) where we will be hosting Shree Devi.  Members from the San Diego Sai Maa community are welcome as are newcomers!!  

We will gather together to socialize, connect, chant, meditate and listen to teachings by Shree Devi.  ALL are very welcome!

About Shree Devi:

Shree Devi is a teacher, spiritual guide and Brahmacharini (nun) in Sai Maa’s spiritual lineage. She offers knowledge and techniques she has cultivated through over 13 years of dedicated spiritual practice as a disciple of Sai Maa, including 6 years studying and living in Sai Maa’s ashram (monastery). She has taught throughout the US and Europe since 2007, leading workshops and courses, empowering hundreds of people to make lasting shifts in themselves and their lives. In 2011, she began offering programs in South America, and has recently moved back to her birthplace of Chile to found VidAlineada, the first organization to share Sai Maa’s teachings in Latin America.

About the Satsang:

Satsang is the practice of gathering together to share spiritual truth. It is a time to be enlivened by the company of people who share the same passion for living their highest potential. Through meditating, chanting, sharing and learning together we serve as divine reflections for one another, reminding us of our greater purpose to awaken in the light. The intention is that we each leave the evening inspired, uplifted and deeply nourished by our divine essence!

Details:

Wednesday, January 6th, 7-9pm

Please email aseas7@hotmail.com  for address and to register.

results.description:
Welcome to our first meeting of 2016, and the start of a video-discussion series with Andy Stanley called "Starting Over – So Next Time Won't Be Like Last Time." What do you do when your original life plan – relationships, career, finances, health, family – hasn't worked the way you wanted it to, and it's time to start again? More information coming soon, but this is a series you won't want to miss as 2016 begins.

OUR WEEKLY MEETINGS:

We will gather each week from 7:00 pm to 9:00 pm. After a brief introduction, we see a video (or at other times of the year, hear from a live speaker) until about 8:00. Then after an overview of our program and some introductions and announcements, we take a short break and go into smaller groups at about 8:15 for the remainder of the meeting. We have a special group for newcomers and visitors, support groups, and discussion groups.

We welcome anyone and everyone dealing with relationship challenges, separation or divorce, whether happening now, in the past, or perhaps approaching. People of any faith background, or without one, are welcome.

DINNER, CHILD CARE AND CHILDREN'S ACTIVITIES:

An optional dinner will be offered at the church before tonight's meeting, and there's a separate Meetup event for that on our Meetup home page. Information on child care and children's activities is available here.

ABOUT OUR MEETUP GROUP:

There are no fees or membership requirements for this program. You do not have to have a Meetup account to attend. If you do have a free Meetup account and join our Meetup group, you'll get automatic reminder messages about our meetings and other news you may need. It would be great if you'd click "Yes" if you're coming to this and future meetings. That makes our group more visible on Meetup, and encourages others to come.

Learn about managing your online identity and privacy in our Meetup group.

Read what others have written about their experiences here. You can contribute your own thoughts on the same page.

Click here for detailed driving and parking directions, and information on how to find our meeting room.

SPREAD THE WORD:

Invite friends, family, co-workers, and anyone else who could benefit. Feel free to send them our web address: 
www.meetup.com/DRR-Burlingame

Use this online form to provide their e-mail addresses, type a brief personal note if you like, and Meetup will do the rest. (The addresses will not be used for any other purpose.)

BAY AREA NEW BEGINNINGS:

You may be interested in this separate but related Meetup group, open to all current and past participants in Bay Area Divorce and Relationship Recovery groups. It's about fun, social events with other emotionally healthy (or at least healing) people. Learn more about Bay Area New Beginnings.

DIVORCE AND RELATIONSHIP RECOVERY NETWORK:

This group and others like it are backed by the non-profit Divorce and Relationship Recovery Network, which is also working to establish and support more much-needed Divorce and Relationship Recovery programs. Besides this group, we offer groups in Menlo Park, Los Gatos, Castro Valley, and Lubbock, Texas.

We do not charge for our meetings, but donations to our cause are greatly appreciated. You can set up online gifts, either one-time or recurring, to support this work. Join the mailing list (separate from this Meetup group) to stay informed.

Please visit and Like us on Facebook, and then Share our postings when they appear on your Facebook page.

Learn more about us at: 
www.divorceandrelationshiprecovery.org

Contact us here.

IF YOU LIVE OR WORK IN SAN FRANCISCO, MARIN COUNTY, OR ON THE SAN MATEO COAST:

We're working hard to start groups like this one in these locations. If you'd be interested, or have friends in those areas that could benefit, please visit and join the appropriate Meetup groups as listed below. Your interest will help us to get started soon! 
www.meetup.com/DRR-SF-Marin 
www.meetup.com/DRR-Coastside

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/DRR-East-Bay"></a>

results.description:
Spiritual learning is not accomplished in the same way three dimensional learning is.  Since we’re accustom to 3D learning we draw the conclusion reading a book will give us spiritual knowledge.  This is not the case, multidimensional understanding cannot be expressed in 3D words any more than a beautiful sunset can be described using only one letter of the alphabet.

Many years of meditation usually covering decades is a time honored way to gain spiritual knowledge and this is the way it’s been for centuries.  What those seeking enlightenment are after is not “thinking” we know but “knowing” we have an understanding.  There is a big difference between the two.  Thinking comes from the head while knowing comes from our spiritual heart center which is where the connection is to our higher natures and all that is.  The brain will not accomplish anything spiritual without being connected through a great deal of practice with our higher-self.

Now for the good part, since the vibration rate of the Earth has been rising for the past twenty years new tools have become available to us especially now that we’ve passed the 2012 Shift.  The energy of Aurora Source Radiance is one which I was introduced to just days before 10-10-2010.  Having worked with this energy daily it became clear immediately the energy is about rapid spiritual growth.  There’s nothing “instant” about learning anything beyond “not grabbing a hot dish from the oven with our bare hands.”  Everything else takes time allowing it to become part of our understanding.  Aurora Source Radiance isn’t instant learning either although it is learning in the “express lane” cutting so many years off the traditional way we learned spirituality in past centuries.  Now is the time for those feeling the call to move forward and learn.

One focus of this spiritual learning teaches us self-empowerment and a greater understanding especially of ourselves.  We share this energy with those having a desire to experience it and for those wishing to experience the healing benefits this energy teaches us.  Those being sensitive to energy will feel how different this energy is.

$10.00 is Requested

results.description:
Let's practice English pronunciation.

To get the most out of this time, you should already be able to understand and speak basic English.  This is not an English class... grammar and vocabulary will not be taught.  We will only focus on making English words and conversation sound better and more comfortable.


Small groups of students working with native English speakers to practice should help us all to find and work through pronunciation problems faster.

I am NOT an English teacher, but I have a good ear listening for common pronunciation mistakes and have experience helping to fix them. 


Anyone is welcome to attend, but since I speak Mandarin I am most comfortable assisting native Chinese speakers.

Some of the time will be just talking to each other.  During the conversation, we'll catch and fix the bad habits that need improving.  We'll also spend a lot of time just reviewing how to say words properly.  Sometimes reading helps, so if you have something you want to practice reading, please bring it.

We will probably have several native English speakers, so we can break out into smaller groups when it is helpful.

-Richard

results.description: The Blind Assassin opens with these simple, resonant words: "Ten days after the war ended, my sister Laura drove a car off a bridge." They are spoken by Iris, whose terse account of her sister's death in 1945 is followed by an inquest report proclaiming the death accidental. But just as the reader expects to settle into Laura's story, Atwood introduces a novel-within-a-novel. Entitled The Blind Assassin, it is a science fiction story told by two unnamed lovers who meet in dingy backstreet rooms. When we return to Iris, it is through a 1947 newspaper article announcing the discovery of a sailboat carrying the dead body of her husband, a distinguished industrialist. Brilliantly weaving together such seemingly disparate elements, Atwood creates a world of astonishing vision and unforgettable impact.
results.name: The Blind Assassin

results.description:
Clayton Burroughs comes from a long line of outlaws.  For generations, the Burroughs clan has made its home on Bull Mountain in North Georgia, running shine, pot, and meth over six state lines, virtually untouched by the rule of law. To distance himself from his family’s criminal empire, Clayton took the job of sheriff in a neighboring community to keep what peace he can.  But when a federal agent with the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, and Firearms shows up at Clayton’s office with a plan to shut down the mountain, his hidden agenda will pit brother against brother, test loyalties, and could lead Clayton down a path to self-destruction.

In a sweeping narrative spanning decades and told from alternating points of view, the novel brilliantly evokes the atmosphere of the mountain and its inhabitants: forbidding, loyal, gritty, and ruthless. A story of family—the lengths men will go to protect it, honor it, or in some cases destroy it—

Bull Mountain is an incredibly assured debut that heralds a major new talent in fiction.
results.name: BULL MOUNTAIN by Brian Panowich

results.description:
Aurora Source Radiance is a fast track path to Self-empowerment

Some would and have understood self-empowerment to mean “I’m going to do it myself.”  In a 3D way this is correct but only from a smaller concept of “self.”  The larger perspective of “self” is greater than a 3D view could be.  When we look in the mirror we see our self.  This self (for most of us with 3D vision) is only a smaller self, a distilled down version of our greater-self and purposefully missing a larger amount of us.  Our 3D self (and/or Ego) seems to have a view “this is it, all that we are is in the mirror.”  This is where some could misunderstand “self-empowerment.”

Self-empowerment is learning to accomplish the physical and spiritual things we want to do on our own although we include and incorporate the greater-self back into what we see in the mirror.  This is self-empowerment, working with ALL of us learning to be an active part of our own team again instead of being separate trying to play a team sport on our own.  By the way this is a foundation of Mastery.

The energy of Aurora Source teaches us to understand more than we knew.  When we have greater comprehension we see other possibilities which were hidden.  Those feeling ready to step forward have a great availability to learn higher spiritual lessons directly from Divine Sources.  The learning is easier than could be believed without books, lectures or notes to take as those cannot convey the multidimensional information we receive directly from the higher realms.  In other words three dimensional teaching will not teach multidimensional lessons, this has been misunderstood for centuries.

We learn to work “with” our Divine Consciousness to accomplish more as we grow spiritually.  As we develop a relationship with the Divine energy of Aurora Source we’re empowered to achieve greater healing through our own expanded understanding of how to manipulate energy for greater health and a better life.  Since we and everything else us is made of energy the only limits are what we understand and will allow ourselves to do.

Aurora Source is an Energy of Transformation, the path of a Master is to use our own Divine power within us to make any changes desired in life.

We share healing sessions for the better health of ourselves and others as we deepen our understanding of this energy, come and experience the energy to see if your path goes in this direction.

$10.00 Requested
results.name: Transforming the Self with Aurora Source Energy

results.description:
What is Bitcoin? How does it work? Who controls it? What is mining? Is it possible to counterfeit bitcoin? This introduction will provide you with a basic understanding of the ins and outs of this and similar digital currencies. After this session, you will have enough basics to get some bitcoin and, if you desire, send it to anyone on Earth in seconds.

MORE ABOUT THE SPEAKER: Donn Lee advises startups and VCs in Internet technologies. Joining Facebook in 2007, he was a senior engineer on the Infrastructure team during hyper-growth of Facebook's systems and networks. Before FB, Donn was a senior engineer at Google during similar architecture, deployment, scaling, and troubleshooting challenges when Google grew from a sole search engine to a portfolio of products. Donn wrote his book Enhanced IP Services for Cisco Networks while working full-time at Cisco Systems, where he was a senior systems engineer. He was awarded Internet Society's Itojun Service Award and Google's EMG Award. Donn has performed over 50 talks at technical conferences across Europe, Asia, US, Canada, and Mexico.
results.name: Bitcoin: Digital Cash -- The Basics

results.description:
Sheldon will be speaking on the topic of Gay Conversion Therapy, providing us with a brief history of the efforts to alter people’s sexual orientation both through religion and therapy, some evidence of the potential risks these processes pose to victims, as well as an overview of the problem in the social, legal, and political domains.

Sheldon Helms is a Professor of Experimental Psychology at Ohlone College in Fremont, CA where he serves as senior faculty member in the psychology department. He holds a master’s degree in psychology, and is currently a doctoral candidate in the School of Education at Alliant International University.


In addition to his fulltime teaching role, Sheldon serves as faculty adviser to the Ohlone Psychology Club through which he runs their successful Speaker Series, hosting lectures and presentations by top-name scientists and skeptics.
Sheldon is the vice president of the Bay Area Skeptics, and serves on the planning committee for the annual SkeptiCal Conference. He is a frequent blogger for the James Randi Educational Foundation, and was recently appointed co-organizer of the Psychology Forum at the Commonwealth Club of San Francisco.

Sheldon is also the host of the popular ShelShocked podcast, whose wide variety of topics and guests have included magician James Randi, psychologist Elizabeth Loftus, ghost hunters Bryan & Baxter, and pop star Belinda Carlisle, to name a few.

results.description:
I've been wanting to see this show for years! When I heard they had re-set this classic Fosse musical in a circus, well - being a clown and circus lover, I knew I had to see it! I have 3 - $25 Tickets!!! - available on a first come, first serve basis. They are in the balcony. Once they are claimed I will remove the payment requirement for RSVPs.

It's a Wed. night and tix are normally priced between $39 and $314... check out this awesome video! 

http://www.san-jose-theater.com/theaters/san-jose-center-for-performing-arts/pippin.php

WELCOME TO THE CIRCUS

A young prince sets out on a journey to find the ultimate meaning of life in the vaudevillian spectacular of Pippin, from Godspell creator Stephen Schwartz. Told by a roving cast of an anachronistic acting troupe, the musical first wowed audiences in 1972, seducing them with an astonishing musical fable set to a rousing 1970's rock score, including the hits 'Magic to Do' and 'I Guess I'll Miss the Man.'

With elements of surrealism and naughtiness, there is a moving core to this quest for fulfilment, told through a medieval fable that still connects with contemporary audiences. Revived on Broadway by director Diane Paulus (Porgy and Bess and Hair) this new incarnation of Pippin won four 2013 Tonys, and is now hitting the road for a bombastic and vivid tour of the USA!

ROLL UP, ROLL UP, THE STORY OF PIPPIN

A young and dreamy prince named Pippin is unhappy with his lot. Overlooked by his errant father King Charles, and mocked by his family, he wants to learn the meaning of life, and takes on a series of thrilling challenges to prove himself. He becomes involved in a war and switches sides to become a revolutionary, whilst leaving a trail of broken hearts all over the land. But perhaps excitement and freedom isn't the key to living, and maybe its modesty that will fill the void.

DID YOU KNOW?

Patina Miller and Ben Vereen have both won a Tony for turns as Leading Player, and are the only two actors of different genders to win for the same role.

- See more at: http://www.san-jose-theater.com/theaters/san-jose-center-for-performing-arts/pippin.php#sthash.xc5yLHFf.dpuf

results.description:
FOXTROT - SMOOTH & ELEGANT!!!   Click here to see DEMO

Foxtrot is the dance of Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers. This smooth and elegant dance had its beginnings in a New York theatre.   Foxtrot has smooth gliding steps with a heel lead, controlled movement and an easygoing look.  It has less rise and fall than the Waltz as the emphasis is on progression.  The foxtrot is an all-purpose dance that can be performed to many different styles of music. Many swing songs are appropriate for Foxtrot.


Here's a short list of songs where Foxtrot is the preferred dance.

Alright, Okay, You Win -  Joe Williams,  The Best Is Yet To Come - Michael Bublé,   Dinah - Dean Martin,    Fly Me To The Moon (In Other Words) -  Frank Sinatra,    I'm Beginning To See The Light -  Ben Webster,  It Had To Be You -  Harry Connick, Jr., Look For The Silver Lining -  Chet Baker,   Mississippi Mud - Dean Martin,  The More I See You - Michael Bublé,   Night & Day - Frank Sinatra,  On An Evening In Roma (Sott'er Celo De Roma) -  Dean Martin


This is a beginning class and ballroom and 22 year veteran instructor Chuck Braswell will guide you through 6-8 beginning patterns in this dance during the 4 week session!


By the end of the classes you will have learned enough moves be able to dance to a complete song!!  At a later date you may want to add on to your basics...look for Foxtrot 1B or  Foxtrot 1C in upcoming weeks. Come join us for a truly fun and friendly time!


DATE & TIME:

Wednesdays  Jan 6, 13, 20, 27  (This is week 1 of a 4 week series)

7:30 - 8:15pm

COST OPTIONS: 

Each four week class $49 !!

OR

Not sure if this class is for you? You can try it for just one night. Take a single class for $15 .

results.description:
Build community! Increase Confidence! Learn New Songs! Be inspired!

Every first Wednesday of the month, experience the art of toning, chanting, singing, and listening well in order to experience communion with one another and with the spirits of music. Simple but profound, these somewhat casual musical rituals form an environment for healing, self-expression, and community building.

The music in your soul is a gift to yourself and to the world!


Song and chant writers, and community ritualists Tymn Urban & Dakini Uma Amitabha offer this simple opportunity to explore your gifts and share them in safe space with others.

Together, we draw from oral tradition (time honored songs that have been passed down over the years) as well as newer material that we have created ourselves.  These circles are not only about learning the songs that we share. YOU are encouraged to come to circle with your own contributions, be they original or traditional.

(Keep in mind that songs or chants presented should be easy to teach and should be of a universally accessible nature.) 

You are also encouraged to bring your drums, shakers, or melodic instruments such as guitar or uke! This is in support of the Voice, which is our focus.

Sharing your voice with the world is a gift, and we honor those who feel called to participate. Your yearning to free your voice, to share your heart-song, your dynamic "yawp", your precious hums of gratitude... is understood and appreciated here. Whatever your contribution, bring it! We will witness you.

For more information, and a general outline of the structure, please visit our Page here on this Meetup:
http://www.meetup.com/DevaGnosis/pages/Sacred_Song_and_Chant/

We'll listen for you in the Circle!

Suggested Donation of $5-$15 sliding scale.
No one turned away for lack of funds.

results.description:
You are all invited to the next meeting of The Bay Area Bird Photographers Meeting
Wednesday January 6 7:30-9:00 PM
Location: Lucy Evans Baylands Interpretive Center on East Embarcadero Rd., Palo Alto


The program will be "A Collection of Birds and Wildlife of Borneo" with John Richardson who writes:

"Another biological hotspot in the world has been under threat for many years, and it shows. The palm oil plantations abound, replacing the vital virgin rain forests over most of the third-largest island in the world. Logging and mining extraction are devastating species and the ancient traditions of native peoples and villages. There are still bright lights in northern Sabah state where the Malyasian government is much more enlightened than the other states of Kalimantan and Sarawak. Sabah has reserved, at least for now, tracts of primary and secondary forests and wetlands for indigenous animals, tourism, and a more traditional way of life. It is a most fascinating place to visit. The animals, orchids, and people are truly wonderful."
results.how_to_find_us: From 101, take Embarcadero Rd going East towards the Bay.  At the very end of embarcadero, take a left and go pass Duck Pond until you reach parking lot.  Walk to the only building on stilts on the Baylands.

DESCRIPTION: The Cha Cha is a vibrant, flamboyant and playful dance. The light and bubbly feel of the Cha Cha gives it a unique sense of fun for dancers throughout the world. The Cha Cha requires small steps and lots of hip motion (Cuban motion), as it is danced in 4/4 time.  It is a fun and flirty dance and will certainly give you a sense of moving on the dance floor!    To see a demo of the dance click here > ChaCha


ChaCha can be danced to many different song types.  Some of those songs include:"Smooth" -  Santana, "Two Pina Coladas" -  Garth Brooks, "Makes Me Wonder" - Maroon5, "Boom Boom Pow" - The Black Eyed Peas, "Kokomo" - The Beach Boys

•  No prior dance experience is required

•  No partner is ever required 

This is a beginning basic class and ballroom and 20 year veteran instructor Chuck Braswell will guide you through 6-8 beginning patterns in this dance during the 4 week session!  By the end of the classes you will have learned enough moves be able to dance to a complete song!!  At a later date you may want to add on to your basics...look for ChaCha 1B or ChaCha  1C in upcoming weeks.

DATE & TIME:

Wednesdays Jan 6, 13, 20, 27 

8:15pm - 9:00pm (This is week 1 of a 4 week session)

COST OPTIONS:

•  Take a single class for $15

OR

•  Take the ENTIRE 4 week series for only $49!

SIGN UP INFO:

Call us  to sign up!  (408)[masked]

Email: [masked]

Web: Our website

Facebook: "More info"

NOTE:  Classes have been evenly distributed (leaders & followers), and not everyone that attends signs up through MeetUp.  Come see us and have some fun and meet new friends.

Tonight we'll be heading back to the Willow Den for a joint meetup with the San Jose Karaoke League (ALPHAbar) social prior to the beginning of their next karaoke competition.  This is a preseason social event before the karaoke competition begins.  If you wish to sign up for the karaoke competition, please check out the rules here:  http://www.meetup.com/SJALPHAbarKaraoke/events/227425413/ ;

There is no cost to attend this Meetup event.  Our Member KJ Chris Elio runs the show at Willow Den and he has a great song list.  So, we know we are in for a treat.   


The Willow Den is located in lovely Willow Glen, not far from Goosetown.  This bar was formerly known as the Checkered Flag Bar, a well-known biker bar.  (Biker bar?  In Willow Glen?  Who knew?)  Anyway, it changed owners a few years back and has been revamped. The Willow Den is located on Lincoln Avenue near 280, literally, just up the street from Goosetown. 

Karaoke starts at 9:30, but we'll be meeting at 9:00 p.m. to save space and sign up early. There will be karaoke party favors and SBK treats for all those good boys and girls who RSVP and show up to sing.  

Hope to see you there.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eoRjguMVvtY

This is the last preseason mixer before we start the season! Meet both league newbies and veterans! This night is a free event and there will be open karaoke for all! This is a good night to see what the league is all about! Teams will be looking for free agents to round out their team!

The next season of karaoke league is open for registration!
Sign up and get more info at <a>www.ALPHAbarKaraoke.com!</a>

YOU MUST BE SIGNED UP BY JAN 12TH TO PLAY IN THE LEAGUE!

************************* Have you ever competed in a karaoke league?! Your team will be judged on how well you SING IT and how well you BRING IT! Sign up as a team, a small group, or just by yourself! We'll put you on a full team before the season begins!


*How does it work?*
Each week of regular season you face off against one other team in the league. You each get a female solo, male solo, and group song. A panel of judges rate you on two 10 point scales for singing it and bringing it! Whichever opponent has more points at the end of the match gets the victory! We have a live scoreboard that tallies your results against the competition! Every week is a new theme: 80s, 90s, Disney, Showtunes, Movie Soundtracks, Oldies... We have a professional grade wireless headset mic so your hands are free to do whatever you want!! At the end of the season you are seeded into a single elimination tourney by number of wins and points!

*What you get in a season*
6 weeks of head to head songs against other teams
End of season single elimination tournament (Top 8 seeded teams only)
Photos and full video of all your performances to share online
Follow your team standings and statistics
Casual social mixers throughout the season to mingle with the league
Drink Specials at our sponsor bar
A preseason party to meet new teammates and the competition
Free league t-shirt/tank

ALPHAbar Karaoke is the ONLY competitive karaoke league in the bay area!

results.description:
Early morning start for folks who want to get their run in before work.

Jump start your day with some dedicated and friendly runners!

We will start at the parking lot of Blackford Elementary School and get on the Los Gatos Creek trail running to Campbell towards Los Gatos.

We make a couple of stops for water and take a little walk break in the middle.

It's an easy straight trail so you can't get lost.

The run will be 6 miles, but one can run further or less as desired.

We have a special procedure for these early morning runs. It is meant to help insure that no one drags themselves out of bed only to be left alone to run. (for safety reasons too)

Goes as follows:

Please RSVP day/night before. (if you don't the meetup will likely be cancelled or I will forget to check back in the morning)

Confirm that you are joining the run no later than 5:10 AM. Two ways to confirm:

meetup in the morning, or change your rsvp.

text me in the morning to confirm. [masked]-1645.

If you do not confirm by one of those two means, then I will expect that you will not be joining and others can adjust their plans accordingly.

It's very rewarding to be finishing your run before the day gets going. It's a bit tough to get used to at first, but soon you may find yourself looking forward to it. It makes for a great day, so come out and join us!
results.name: [Willow Glen-Los Gatos Creek Trail] Early Morning Run

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
